website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for someone who wants to take the guesswork out of crepe making.
pros: Perfect for those who prefer electric appliances and want an automated process for making multiple crepes
An indicator light alerts you when the crepe is done cooking
cons: Some owners complain that the spreader tool is flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Now after 2+ years of use, I can report that this is better than I could have imagined.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2017 for my wife to produce jianbing or bobing (Chinese crepes). Wow, what a great kitchen appliance. It has without a doubt the best nonstick surface and thermostatic control of any of our appliances (at any price). In addition to bobing, I have used it to grill cod, shrimp, pancakes, pot-stickers (grill won ton), grilled sandwiches and I have yet to burn or destroy anything! If looking for this kind of device I highly recommend this brand & model.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Having had numerous opportunities to eat crepes in Paris France while living there, we have been hard pressed to find a cooking tool to be able to match that quality. Until now! This crepe maker could only have been better if it operated with natural gas so I could go out and make crepes on the street as in Paris. Holds the temp, even cooking on all surfaces, non stick surface is awesome, heat recovery is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Make!
customer_reviews.text: I love this crepe maker that comes with all the right tools. I made near perfect crepes on the first try. The green light turned off when the heating surface was perfect for adding the batter. I loved using the spreader tool in a circular motion to thin out the batter for evenly cooking. The wooden spatula made it easy to turn over the crepe in one piece. Can’t wait to try out more recipes!

customer_reviews.title: well packed with good accessories. I don't like it
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived as described, well packed with good accessories. I don't like it, though, because it's really hard to use (no fault of seller - this is the nature of making crepes on a machine like this.) Griddle gets very hot very fast. Bought it as test for a catering job (if it worked, I would have bought 3 more.) However, too hard to manage temp and spreading (not enough experience.) Instead, I used portable gas burners with small omelet plans for appetizer-sized crepes. Recipe book is included (that recipe for crepes is a good basic one.) Base seems to be made of plastic, so entire thing is very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Christilynnchef

customer_reviews.title: ... mine since getting it and trying to find a good balance between the heat setting and the amount of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing with mine since getting it and trying to find a good balance between the heat setting and the amount of batter used. The ladle provided is far to small for the thickness necessary to create a crepe in which to fill and fold (Japanese street style) - but I've been happy with it overall. The heat settings seem to jump and leave a brown ring easily vs. even heating across the top which is why I took a star off.

It's good for the price, but I don't know if I'd get it again. I think a basic pan would do the same thing to be honest. This is just another fancy kitchen gadget. The scraping stick is not as easy to use as it looks on the videos. I probably wouldn't invest in one if I had to do it over again.
